title.narrative: 6.1 COMMS, ADVOCACY AND PARTNERSHIP

description.narrative: Policy makers, media, donors and civil society organisations engaged to promote children's and women rights, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Well-coordinated and result-based planning, M&E, Communication, Advocacy and Partnership are in place to enhance the Rwanda Country Programme effectiveness and efficiency

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policy makers, media, donors and civil society organisations engaged to promote children?s and women rights

description.narrative: Effective documentation and advocacy through media and child participation increased awareness of the target population and donors, and increased donor engagement and child rights promotion on programme priorities | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/12/2017

title.narrative: of district children forums influencing at least one key children issue in the district plans

actual.value: 2018:Implementation started in August 2017. Advocacy meetings with government officials is ongoing and commitment by government officials to have child representation in all district and sector council committees. Awareness to the community/parents is ongoing. Currently there are two district and 16 sect

title.narrative: of children and families reached through public and private sector partnerships

actual.value: 2018:On track. 100 families trained on care for child development, child-friendly places established around SORWATHE tea company. 600 children access pre-primary schools with SORWATHE support, and teachers were trained with UNICEF support. Approximately 8,000 individuals reached with messages on ECD and

title.narrative: of Institutions/Universities who are incorporating Media Module on child rights and ethical reporting

actual.value: 2018:On track. The module was developed, validated and used to train 70 practicing journalists. The integration in the learning programs of the academic institutions started with the academic year 2018. On track with this indicator
